Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bev F
Reviews.Content: This is a smaller hotel so not too crowded. Very convenient location. Within walking distance of the gorgeous new Opera House. Comfortable bed with triple sheets. Good food. Only criticism is the tub/shower should have grab bars.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful art decor step back in time with modern convenience”
Reviews.Author: CiCiTX
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a birthday weekend away. The hotel was beautiful and quiet (at least that weekend). He made a spa appointment for a massage but the therapist went home sick. The spa was great and gave me a facial instead which came from a very knowledgeable staff. Our room was a nice size with soothing colors and a great view of downtown. Great bar in the lobby that looked very popular on Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible front desk”
Reviews.Author: Kelly G
Reviews.Content: I was excited when my family arrived in Dallas last night and checked in at the Stoneleigh Hotel & Spa. The interior is gorgeous and the parking attendants and night staff were incredibly helpful. I thought I'd definitely like to stay here on future trips. Our first morning here, I was ready to head out with my kids to get a Starbucks as I'm an avid coffee drinker. I saw several hotel guests walk in with Starbucks so I knew there was one within walking distance. One of the guests told me it was very close. I stopped by the front desk to ask for directions to the nearest Starbucks. The response I got was frankly rude. There were two people at the desk as well as the door man. After simply staring at us for a moment, they told me that there is a Starbucks at the Crescent hotel (two blocks away), but that it is closed on Saturdays. I asked if they were sure because I saw several guests walk in with Starbucks. The man said absolutely it is closed on Saturdays. I asked him for the next nearest Starbucks and he gave general directions. My kids and I walked a couple miles before I called the Crescent and found out it is indeed open. We walked back to Crescent got our coffee and went back to Stoneleigh. I informed the front desk that the Crescent is open and they might want to tell their visitors such when they ask. The gal looked at me blankly. No apology for the inconvenience or thank you for informing them so they can give their guests the correct information. No hospitality, no friendly service - rude. My husband and I travel a lot and stay in very nice hotels. Next time we will stay at the Crescent.

Reviews.Title: “excellent business stay”
Reviews.Author: mattgid
Reviews.Content: from the valet staff to the house keepers, great service. hotel is in uptown and walking distance to the nightlife; didn't eat there nor drink at the bar, but all looked good. didn't do any spa services. very nice room clean remodeled; would stay again; recommend for business or pleasure

Reviews.Title: “Superb property, superlative service”
Reviews.Author: Rex N
Reviews.Content: Just concluded another stay at the Stoneleigh and wanted to share some comments on this somewhat unknown jewel of a hotel. First, the service - each time I arrive the valets know me by name, have a smile and ask if they can help, this has never happened to me in any other hotel (as a result I've gotten to know them well) and is a great first impression for the Stoneleigh. I don't know if the staff has daily training on arriving guests or they just have a naturally great staff, but from the front desk to the concierge to bartender and Bolla waitstaff they provide great service with a smile and most seem to know me by name. I eat breakfast there on occasion when time permits (Texas Benedict is truly unique and also wonderful), and asked for a slight change to the menu item one time, since that time, I've been asked without fail "would you like the Texas Benedict as you ordered before?". Again, this is unique in my experience and speaks to both the tenure and professionalism of the staff. A quick review of the room itself: They rooms are very nice with comfortable beds and great linens, and the soaring ceilings of a property built long ago. Although there are many different room configurations, and all the rooms I've stayed in are spacious with very good closet space and a super nice bathroom including great toiletries. The walls are thick and I've never been bothered by noise from a guest next door. As expected in hotel in this category there are nice flat screen TVs and reliable wi-fi. One of the most important qualities in a hotel is cleanliness and the Stoneleigh staff does a great job - my room is always sparkling and fresh. I could go on about all the other items that make for a great hotel - have never run out of hot water, plenty of water pressure in the shower, etc. The hotel lobby and bar are uique and have great seating which is unusual and ecletic, but provides for good people watching. The bartenders are knowledgeable and friendly. The hotel has kept the qualities of its heritage while integrating technology, and providing great service. Stay here once and you'll be back! One important item to me is cleanliness

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emily0717
Reviews.Content: Fabulous boutique hotel - loved the decor. Best part was the large room with seating area (two plush chairs). Friendly and courteous staff - really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We enjoyed the outdoor seating - good for catching up with friends with a drink from the bar. The hotel restaurant, Bolla, has excellent breakfast. For lunch walk a couple of blocks over to Nick & Sam's Grill - lots of choices from pecan crusted trout to burgers to pulled pork tacos. Reasonable walk to the West End & Dealey Plaza; lots of shops and restaurants (albeit many chains- Hard Rock, Hooters, etc). We wanted to try the pizza place NEO but did not have time. The only downside is that my room did not have a bath tub, only a shower (however it was a 2-person large shower.

Reviews.Title: “Total Lack of Service!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: I have to start this review off by letting you all know that I'm NOT a diva! I posted a great review of The Stoneleigh a while back. But I have since changed my mind, and this is why: My daughter, who lived in Dallas, got married last September. I must've made a trip to Dallas at least once a month for a year and always stayed at The Stoneleigh because of it's convenient location, great rates and it was a nice hotel. We booked 40 rooms for the weekend of my daughter's wedding and held a party the night before for over 100 people on their penthouse floor-using The Stoneleigh's food and beverage. Even when I wasn't staying at the hotel, we would go there for drinks either in the bar or on the patio. We also referred many friends to stay there. I don't know about you, but I think that added up to a LOT of $$$$$. My youngest daughter and I stayed at The Stoneleigh last weekend while visiting my middle daughter. When I arrived, no one offered to help with my bags, upon checking in, there was no recognition that I was a return guest, much less having spent thousands of $ the past year at the hotel. I was pointed in the direction of the elevator, not shown to the room, etc...(not that I needed that, but it would've been nice for someone to ask). During my entire stay, the toiletries or mini bar were never refilled or replenished. There obviously were 2 people staying in the room, but only 1 bed was turned down. I couldn't get the free wifi to connect and called reception to help. I was given some instructions that I had already tried, I said I would just figure it out, she said OK and hung up. We met some friends in the bar for drinks and the staff were unfriendly and rude. I had breakfast in the Bolla Restaurant the last morning before checking out. I was pleasantly seated and then waited and waited for a waiter to acknowledge me. I had to ask a bus boy twice to send my waiter-and I was only 1 of 2 parties in the whole restaurant. After my food arrived, he never came to ask if everything was OK. I also had to flag him down to get my check when I finished. At this point, I was boiling. At least the food was good. The Stoneleigh Hotel is a gorgeous deco hotel-the public rooms are beautifully decorated, and the guestrooms are large and spacious. The only thing this hotel is lacking is SERVICE. There is none. I should say that I was told by one of the valet's-with a scowl on his face, that new management had stepped in about 6 weeks ago, and things had changed for the worse. I will give a shout out to the Valet guys-they were the best part of my visit. They were courteous and called me by name and always knew which car was ours. I'm not asking for special treatment or want to be a VIP, but it seems that somewhere, someone would see a guest profile and recognize that we've been regular guests of The Stoneleigh and would, at least, be welcomed back. I was very disappointed with my visit. I'm not sure I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lallen2882
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a fantastic place to stay in the urban area of uptown Dallas. It's been updated and has all of the perks. We didn't use the spa as we were actually in town for a wedding but the bar was happening, the restaurant had EXCELLENT food and the service was stellar. It's a bit on the pricey end but they provide the service to justify it. From the vallet drivers, doormen, baggage delivery, wait staff, housekeeping and front desk staff you recongize where your dollar is going. The rooms are airy, the bed was comfortable (turndown service), the wi-fi was a bonus as my husband had to work a lot of the time we were there. There is a bar/restaurant directly accross the street that we enjoyed and it is close to many other bars/restaurants/shopping and is just shy of downtown. Overall great place to stay. The only reason I didn't give it a "Excellent" review was that there is a highrise being build across the street so at 7:00 am every morning, we could look directly out our window and see construction men on the 7th floor. Plus the noise they make woke us up.

Reviews.Title: “Overprice!!! Need some type of free parking”
Reviews.Author: Superpaul20
Reviews.Content: It was good hotel. Very clean but pricey.. Make sure you bring alot of money

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in a Modest Package”
Reviews.Author: hamrow
Reviews.Content: Honestly it was not much to look at from the street. The big sign on top of the hotel during the daytime looked a bit old and tired and the streetview is not overwhelming upon first drive by. it turns out this is a very old hotel that was recently renovated. But once you drive up to the front, you begin to see the historic charm of the front facade, which overall is actually a nice break from all the steel and glass and modernity of many newer hotels. we had signed up through some 3rd party hotel reservation site and there was a small box to provide comments to the hotel during the reservation process. in this box I simply said "this is our anniversary", not knowing if the hotel staff would even receive the remark or read it. To our surprise apparently they did because within 5 minutes of checking in, a bottle of complimentary champagne showed up at our door! Also, they had given us a corner room with nice views. the room and bed were extremly nice & comfortable. it is a mix of new and old; the old large windows are single pane, yet the bathroom fixtures are all new; very large bathroom, large shower, everything worked well. All the staff were very nice, the lobby and bar downstairs were nice and well appointed. its also within walking distance to a few restaurants. My only complaint was that parking is $21/night. I know this has become common in a lot of big city hotels, but lets face it; this is just a price hike. I still relish smaller town hotels where parking is free ;)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBfromKC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in mid-March 2012. A great experience. Older, Art Deco hotel that has been beautifully updated. Large guest rooms and bathrooms. Really lovely decorating. Bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. Small but very chic bar off lobby. More than adequate work out room in basement. I didn't try the full-service spa or the beautiful restaurant. Not as expensive as you would think. We paid $189 a night, which is competitive with the standard chain hotels nearby. But felt like a high-end resort - very relaxing. In a great neighborhood - you can walk to many nice restaurants and night spots. Only things I didn't like was the lack of any parking except valet - which was expensive at $21/day. And the bedside lamps were too dim to allow reading in bed. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “80% of a luxury hotel at 50% of the price”
Reviews.Author: caruso81
Reviews.Content: For all the one- and two-star whiners, you need to adjust your expectations. Specifics... - Rooms? Large, tasteful, and comfortable. I wouldn't say opulent, but that's not really what they're trying for. - Pricey valet only parking...but they do have transportation. - Is there street noise? OF COURSE! It's a hotel in the city on a street. Exactly what part of that is disappointing or in any way under the control of the hotel? - The spa? Yes,, on the high end of the price range. Your choice. - The gym is small but modern....not sure exactly what the complaints are about. My abs hurt all the same. - Nothing in the area? Completely wrong. Numerous exceptional restaurants within walking distance (Capital Grille, Perry's) in all price ranges, and a couple world-class places within a short taxi ride (Abacus, Stephen Pyles). - Bolla restaurant in the hotel? Meh. Not bad but you can do better within a ten minute walk. Bar is small but seating spread out in the lobby. - Unfriendly staff? Not really. This is a hotel for grown ups, not a cruise ship for cheap Americans. It reminds me a bit of a 4-star level in Paris. Efficient, stylish, upscale but not over the top, and just a touch "distant." You want paper hats and trumpets when you arrive? Again, try a cruise. - Prices? Well, it's not a LaQuinta, but then again it's not a LaQuinta. Yes, there is the occasional sense that they don't need to overcharge for absolutely everything, but it is in the center of uptown Dallas. Lots of money. If you want cheap, head to the suburbs. So, if you want the Ritz or Palomar, go down the street, pay the $400 a night, and all of your nitpicks will go away. Or pay the $190 a night for a large suite, attentive staff, small but nicely appointed bar, and an interesting boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but disorganized spa and inaccurate charges hampered experience”
Reviews.Author: Julie P
Reviews.Content: Me and 5 girlfriends recently stayed at the hotel for a spa weekend for my sisters upcoming wedding. The hotel was beautiful, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. However, the spa consistently couldn't seem to handle our group reservations; they were late in starting appointments, 4 of the 6 of us had incorrect agendas, and one of the nail technicians chose to yell at two of the girls for the spa's mix up and confusion, saying "all day your group has been confusing us!" (as if it were our fault the front desk was disorganized) Then, after checking out, I realized that not only were we charged for mini bar items we didn't use, but they added $100 to each room charge as a "hold" fee, even though there is no mention of it when you check in, or on the paperwork you sign at checkout. Considering you're already paying $300/room, and I had two rooms, it seems a little unnecessary to do that for each room when I'm already paying with a credit card (might be reasonable for a debit card I suppose). The disorganization and billing practices detracted from what could be a 5-star hotel. I wouldn't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.....but read the fine print for extras”
Reviews.Author: DFWTravelerDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Stoneleigh hotel (we are locals, just wanted to get away for a night here in town) and our room was every bit as good as expected. We opted for one of the larger suites. The room was incredibly spacious and comfortable, well decorated and modern. We both enjoy historic hotels with a modern feel, that still have kept some of the historic charm at the same time. Stoneleigh fits the bill very well in that regard. We ate dinner and breakfast at Bolla. I would say that Bolla is OK, but for the price there are better options here locally. Nothing was unacceptable, but for the price point I'm just not sure it quite meets my expectations or matches the quality of other places here locally in the same price range. Both my wife and I also went to the spa and had a great experience. I am not typically a "spa" type person, however I have to say having had a very nice massage here I can see why some people are. I would say I'm more inclined to have a massage in the future having had one here. The only thing that took me by surprise was the gratuity charge that showed up on our bill when we checked out of our room. There was a mandatory 20% gratuity charge on top of the fairly steep prices for their services at the spa. We were not aware of this initially and I had planned to call the hotel to ask about this, however we went back and read the fine print and it was listed on the pricing sheet, we just didn't see it. So I would say the spa is very nice, just be sure you are aware of the fine print before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Texas sized rooms!”
Reviews.Author: malibert
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night on a business trip. Very comfortable bed, enormous room, huge bathroom, and friendly staff. There is an ok bar in the lobby and ok breakfast in the morning. I don't know Dallas very well but it seems to be very close to downtown but in a walkable area. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing tops The Stoneleigh Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I were just in Dallas for a medical conference this past weekend and decided to try The Stoneleigh Hotel. We were blown away from the moment we stepped out of the car. Walking into the lobby, we were immediately impressed with the decor and both commented that it was unlike any hotel we had ever been in before. We were equally impressed by the customer service throughout the trip, from top to bottom. The entire Stoneleigh staff goes above and beyond to make your experience top notch from the front desk, to housekeeping, to the staff at The Bolla Restaurant. We had dinner at the restaurant the first night and loved the ambience this place had to offer along with the highest of quality food. Our rooms were both beautifully decorated and spacious, and extremely clean which is always something that I take careful note of any place I stay. We didn't get a chance to try out the spa, but took a quick look at it and will definitely carve out time the next trip as it looked wonderful and inviting. Bottom line is this is the place to stay if you are ever in the Dallas area and we will return every time!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: swb2011
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel located in the trendy Uptown of area of Dallas is indeed a real jewel. My wife and I travel to Dallas often to see our children and grandchild. The Stoneleigh makes us feel "at home" every time we are there. The entire staff is friendly and helpful....always willing to go the extra mile for a guest. The rooms are not expensive...especially relative to the competition in the immediate area....and the rooms are each a little different...reflecting the old world charm of this historic structure. The restaurant , bar and spa are wonderful. At The Stoneleigh Hotel...nothing is a problem....we look forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Jwaskowiak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the stoneleigh just last week prior to leaving for maui...what a joke. This hotel is a house of cards and a total sham. Windows to see our view of the city were terribly cloudy with grime, tv didnt work, bed was creaky and caved in the middle, room service never delivered our breakfast. Also, the hotel staff lied on the phone twice to us about an item they said they had in their posession that we forgot in the room when we left, and upon return to retrieve the item we waited for over 45 mins in the lobby while they "retrieved" it...all the while the front desk staff fumbled around on their computers and phones laughing amongst themselves. We never got the item they said they had. Beware of this gimmick of a quality 5 star hotel, andont expect much if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Stoneleigh For Business is Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mardenco
Reviews.Content: In this part of town for business travel The Stoneleigh is a good bet (as compared to the Warwick, Palomar or even the Mansions â€“ have not stayed at The Ritz yet). The rooms are comfortable, quite and clean and the bathrooms have been completely redone (unlike the Warwick). I stay in the studio suite for some extra room. While I have not tried the spa, this is not a hotel of elevated personal service like The Four Seasons â€“ they have trouble calling you by name and there is a small front desk area with typically one person working, so you have to wait. The hotel bar could use a little more customer focus also, and dining was typical, but there is a great steak place across the street. If you are on business, go to the bar at the Warwick and stay in a comfortable room at The Stoneleigh. If you want a higher level of personal attention, go to the Crescent, Four Seasons, etc. as this is a notch down.

Reviews.Title: “A nice change”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeandJaki
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to stay in a hotel that isn't part of a bland chain and has some real character architecturally and atmospherically. Built in the 1920s the Stonleigh has evidently benefited from sustained celebrity patronage (as demonstrated on the wall of fame adjacent to the lobby) and has been kept in pristine condition that belying it's Â years. Rooms are spacious and comfortable and bathrooms are well appointed and modern. I didn't have dinner in the hotel, there are less formal places close by, but breakfast was a work of art and tasty too. Not cheap, but absolutely top quality. Staff are friendly and service is attentive. Situated in a quiet part of town, this is a hidden gem. And wi-fi is free too - marvellous.Â

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ronruss
Reviews.Content: This place is old style upper class; probably out of my class. Service, food, room, facilities were all first class.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average...”
Reviews.Author: Jenny W
Reviews.Content: I was super excited to go and stay here but the Stoneleigh was just average in my opinion. It is in a good location for restaurants and is near pretty much everything, which is good.. The check in was easy but they were not very welcoming. The valet was about the same. The spa, oh geez, had to cancel some of our treatments because they didn't have the staff. They were not very organized and my mom and I were supposed to go at the same time but they had to change that as well. Also, the staff at the hotel are not very friendly either. The worst part was the bellmen at check out. I called twice to get assistance with our luggage and no one ever came. We had to drag our luggage down to the valet and all of the bellmen that were just standing around. We also walked past a man that worked there as we were dragging our bags and he didn't even ask to help!!! Next time I will probably stay somewhere else, it was nothing great and it was not worth the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for business travel”
Reviews.Author: LLRS1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Stoneleigh four times in the last three months. The first time I stayed here, I assumed that the rooms, and especially the bathrooms, would be small since the hotel is in an old historic building. However, the bathrooms are quite large, with giant bathtubs, and each room I have had has included a giant walk-in closet. The hotel is very comfortable and stylish. I have not eaten dinner at the restaurant, but several times I have ordered a salad at the bar (delicious) and the breakfast is also very good. The fitness center has all the basic equipment (it's been empty every time I have used it). The Katy Trail is a short walk from the hotel, so that is a nice option for walking / running nearby. I have no complaints about the hotel at all, so I am surprised at some of the negative reviews. I will continue to stay at the Stoneleigh when I am in Dallas on business.

Reviews.Title: “Save $100 per night and stay at the Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: TNgirl55
Reviews.Content: Booked online for a weekend trip. I never received a confirmation number or email. Worried me a bit so I called and they provided me the number over the phone. When we arrived the air in the room seemed stagnant. We didn't worry about this at the time. Our first morning, we ordered room service for breakfast at 8:30. The committed to a 20 minute delivery. After 40 minutes we called back and it was clear they had misplaced the order. The staff member found the order (after a few minutes of asking questions like "who did you talk to?"), and promised to rush it and have it there in 20 minutes. The second night we had stagnant air again, and struggled all night with temperature control. They also removed some of the bed pillows from the room on that day. Flat down pillows, which were terrible. Booked spa appointments for a party of 4 for the second day. Received a call 2 hours prior to appointment indicating that one of the staff didn't come in, so 2 of us couldn't get our treatments. When the other 2 tried to cancel (hello, party of 4), they were informed that it would be a 50% cancellation fee. They went to the appointment instead of paying the fee, but the spa was running so behind that they were able to get out of the appointments. Same issue again on the third night, except now the bathroom smells like mold. When we reported this, the staff seemed unconcerned. Positives: excellent valet staff, convenient to great restaurants. Definitely not worth $260 per night. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind”
Reviews.Author: Jchgo972
Reviews.Content: I stay here everytime I travel to Dallas for work and I am always pleased. The rooms are huge and comfortable, the location is great and they have an amazing restaurant/bar. Last time I stayed at the Stoneleigh, the valet remembered my last name, the front desk person (WIll) had my key waiting for me and the bartender knew my drink. 5 star service without the price...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility With Disappointing And Non-Responsive Management”
Reviews.Author: thomaswhall
Reviews.Content: First of all the facility is top notch. The hotel has beautiful decor and a clean and spacious rooms. With its location it would seem to be the perfect hideaway in uptown. I booked our stay for late August to celebrate a 15th wedding anniversary. Just a quiet getaway from the family featuring a couples massage and a nice dinner. Simple enough you might think. I made my reservation over the phone and booked a room with a massage a hotel reservationist. Just a normal room and a massage, no problem. About halfway through the week I decided to move a bit more upscale on the room and went online to change the reservation. The reservationist failed to fill out the â€œMr.â€� on the reservation on their system and the web form would not allow me to update the reservation without it, nor could I enter the required data. I called the hotel and was routed to an offsite service who had absolutely no clue on how to correct the reservation. (really now, isnâ€™t that their job?) the service suggested I call the hotel directly and ask to speak to an in house reservationist. I did so, and requested the upgrade. For some reason or another they could not change the reservation in the system, but had to cancel it and start over again. This in itself didnâ€™t seem to be an issue, after all it is just a room and a massage. After 20 minutes I was told the reservation was complete. We arrived on the Saturday afternoon and were impressed by the facility and the room. Strike One: At 5:00 we went down to have our massage. Immediately we knew there was an issue. They had no therapists. The hotel reservationist failed to recreate the massage appointment! The Spa manager was very professional, and finally traced the system and figured out what happened but could only offer us a rain check she knew we could never use. She did however attempt to bring staff in to perform the massage but was unsuccessful in finding two therapists. I believe she did whatever she could, but was also at a disadvantage from the beginning. Strike Two: We were quite disappointed with the end result and notified the manager on duty of the situation, and our dissatisfaction with the end result. He said he would look into it. We never heard back from him during our stay. Strike Three: A few weeks later I received a satisfaction survey where I expressed the issues and concerns. Nothing ever came of it. 10 days later I wrote directly to the management staff and again nothing. Back To The Dugout! While I imagine this is not a typical issue at the Stoneleigh, it does point to a greater issue of organizational and customer service arrogance. If I had never made a change to the reservation I would most likely have been fine. I realize issues happen, but the way management handle these issues is what turns an unhappy customer, into a repeat customer. In this case the management choice of inaction speaks volumes. Looking at this example I would never book the Stoneleigh for anything other than an overnight stay. If they canâ€™t get a basic reservation right then why would I trust them with anything more important?

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Middle of the City”
Reviews.Author: lsneed62
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the nicest hotels I have ever been to. The room was beautiful and quite comparable to some of the 5 star hotels in Hollywood and Beverly Hills. The staff was really friendly and helpful and made us feel as special as anyone else there. We had dinner at the restaurant there and it was perfect. The servers were so nice (even when we used a Travelzoo coupon) and the food was delicious. The next morning I had a massage in the spa and that was one of the best massages I have ever had (ask for Mac). All in all a perfect romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Magical night in restored glory”
Reviews.Author: bfpop
Reviews.Content: We recently received a Groupon for a night's stay and breakfast at this absolutely BEAUTIFUL, recently restored landmark hotel. The decor is incredible, the appointments in the rooms first rate, and the staff friendly and knowledgable. I even told the desk person at checkout that this was the best hotel experience my wife and I have had in years. Also, there was a wedding taking place there that evening. And they looked like they would agree with every word of my assessment. Magical.

Reviews.Title: “YIKES!!”
Reviews.Author: SoCal1987
Reviews.Content: There's something rotten going on at The Stoneleigh. Good news: they've nailed the first impression with great doormen who very nicely open doors for guests. Fabulous. Spectacular.... And then? The carpet in the elevators rival the stains of a college dorm room. The smell attracts one's attention to the disgusting carpet. Breakfast at the Bolla bar rivals the La Quinta with lukewarm food. The packets of empty sugar used for my coffee were allowed to pile up. I had to request them to be cleared after an hour. And again, the carpet in the Bolla needed a quick vacuum from the night before. I had to weave my way around crumbs and debris. Check out. WOW. Here's where things get funny. I found a $97 charge for dinner. I did not have dinner here. The lady next to me at check out remarked, "Oh! That happened to us too!" Interesting. Suspicious. Rotten? Possibly. The checkout girl had no explanation, but did tell me to contact my bank regarding all those "pending charges" they added to my bill. Nice. Is Hospitality an online college course these days? Because some communication skills and customer service skills are lacking. Yikes! The Stoneleigh is trying hard to be upscale, and sadly falling short.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations too high for spa”
Reviews.Author: bnbyoung
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, we didn't stay but instead used the spa for an afternoon treat. Thinking the Stoneleigh was a 5 star hotel, expected the same for the spa. While services were okay, expectations were extremely far from being met. When we checked in, recieved our locker with spa robe and slippers.......only to find slippers were mismatched. Okay, an mistake most likely made by housekeeping. I really wanted to overlook that one. Soon after, received treatment from therapist who didn't seem to care about my comfort. Asked if there were another room or for options since cold air was blowing directly on me, therapist said they did all they could..... by stuffing towels in the air vent! Not the 5 star quality I was expecting. Then, to make things worse, therapist never checked in to see how her pressure was. I could have said something, but was fully expecting it to be all about me. It wasn't, at all. Had to feel like I had to ask for everything. Later, enjoyed the rain shower and spa bathtub. Although tub took way too long to fill, once it did fill was relaxing and nice. Could have used some cold towels to put on my neck/face during soak or even a cold bottle of water. Once through with soak, got up to discover towel was totally freyed on one side. No apologies or real effort to make it right - only a "you could of asked us for another one". Towel appeared clean, however, again for 5 star the details were missing. No real amenities like hair ties/clips to use while in bath, and once you got out, only 1 hair dryer to fight over in the dressing area. No steam room or sauna in this facility either. No plastic bags for bathing suits, after asking for that I felt I really asked for alot. Again, attention to detail really missing. I'm very disappointed that I wasn't even offered some kind of genuine apology, at the very least, they could have tried to win me back by offering a discount on next visit or something. I will not take the time to try again, too many details went missing to the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night and enjoyed it very much. Lovely hotel. Very nice rooms and bathroom. Different than the usual hotel room since it was in a historic building. Very large tub and large flat screen tv. Beds very comfortable and hotel was pretty quiet although we could hear some tv noise late at night from adjacent room and outside equipment so a different location might have been better within hotel. The only negative surprise was the lack of parking and the valet cost of $20.00 per vehicle per night. Pretty high in our experience for the Dallas area. Bolla restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel and Great Room”
Reviews.Author: ccctravels
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to stay at this hotel for awhile. I got a great deal on Groupon Getaway so we decided to try it out. The decore is fantastic and I really love the lobby bar! We were pleasantly surprised with our room. It was a great size and so well appointed. It was decorated so well! I loved the mix of historic with modern. We both had massages at the spa and while the spa isn't overly fancy the treatments were good and the spa is clean and new. We had a few drinks in the bar before dinner which was fun and breakfast in the restaurant in the morning. The buffet breakfast was included in the groupon. It was pretty good just not a ton of choices. One negative was that the eggs were more like chilaquilas and there was not an option for just regular eggs. Not a big deal to me but my boyfriend was wishing for plain old eggs! We both agreed that this would absolutely be on our list for future staycations!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: krwilden
Reviews.Content: Having to travel for business is usually very run of the mill when it comes to staying at a hotel. But not if you get the chance to stay at The Stonleigh. It us such a wonderful landmark hotel in Dallas. It is completely modern and relaxing. Rooms are so comfortable and decorated very nicely. The bar in the lobby is a highlight and is quite lively in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simone N
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many beautiful hotels and I would have to say that the Stoneleigh is the best boutique hotel I've ever experienced. The quality of the room was outstanding, maintaining the original 1920s feel but updated stylishly for a luxurious finish and incredibly comfortable stay. Ideally located in a fashionable part of town and within easy walking distance to some great eating places and McKenny drive. The size of the room and bathroom was very generous. The only downside was the noise of the aircon - however, earplugs did the trick. The best value for money. I would highly recommend anyone visiting Dallas to look no further than the Stoneleigh Hotel. I can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Color scheme was lovely”
Reviews.Author: Issabella
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took advantage of everything the hotel had to offer by booking a massage and eating dinner at Bolla. Everything was very nice but nothing was extraordinary. I was disappointed because of the hotels high star rating. The color scheme of the room was lovely and will be what I remember from the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LBtravelernm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful historic hotel. The room I had was very large with a giant TV that splits the bedroom area from the living area. Great bed!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but with problems”
Reviews.Author: amxsunshine
Reviews.Content: We had the expedia rate so I will start by saying it was good value. However, this is not is not top tier, they renovated this hotel and ran out of money, as evidenced by the skeleton on an extension attached to the hotel and the swimming pool that has been a work in progress since 2008. We had to move rooms because they could not fix the wireless on our floor- but found out at 2am that it was to where the wedding party was going on -with a 1yr old it wasn't ideal. We then moved again (at2am) to a different room! Moving back in the morning. No appologies, no discussion. In every room we were in I was fixing the drawer handles! On one occasion I left them on top- but it was left by house keeping until I fixed them. Good management would have handled all problems -particulary the room switches. A shoe string operation. Would we go back? Depends on the rate i think. The restaurant and staff (Bolla) are fabulous, as the valet personel and security -it's really front of house and housekeeping that needs the tune up!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed, spotlessly clean, overpriced boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCDoctor
Reviews.Content: The Stoneleigh is a very fine unique property with clean spacious rooms and good location convenient to most of what Dallas has to offer. Unlike prior reviewers, I found the fitness facility to have new, modern equipment and to be good for business travel. However, the wifi was intermittent and this was frustrating. I believe the hotel rates are overpriced compared to others not far away. For a better rate, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: dallaskay_10
Reviews.Content: We decided to celebrate our anniversary by spending a day visiting Dallas wineries (there are 4 in the area) and then having a nice dinner and overnight at the Stoneleigh Hotel. To top off this treat, we booked a facial and massage for the next morning at their Spa. Absolutely every aspect of our stay was perfect. Our room was lovely, the bed was extremely comfortable. Dinner at Bolla was fantastic, and definitely a highlight. The Chef came out personally to interact and explain dishes, and the wait service was professional and utterly flawless. We ordered room service the next morning and our meal arrived beautifully presented, on time, hot and fresh. Our Spa experience was, if possible, even better. The Spa itself is beautifully appointed, luxurious, and our masseuse and esthetician (Kara and Akhtar) were both frankly gifted. Every aspect of our stay turned out to be a 12 on a 10 scale, I wish we had found this jewel sooner.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly...”
Reviews.Author: CanuckTexan
Reviews.Content: I can only describe our stay at The Stoneleigh as HEAVENLY! The Valet We started our weekend with a warm greeting from the valet who assured us our bags would be safe and sound in the car until check-in (weâ€™d arrived way before designated check-in for our spa services). The Lobby Gorgeous, hip, energized...we loved the look and feel of the hotel right from the start. The Spa WONDERFUL...the facilities are gorgeous and our couples massage was the BEST way to start our stay. I'd like to give a huge shout out to Chandra, my masseuse, she was amazing! I've had a lot of these kinds of services and nothing comes close to the experience at The Spa at Stoneleigh. I was transported and felt like a million dollars for hours and hours afterwards! I then enjoyed the relaxation room (cool cucumbers for my eyelids) hydro tubs (15 minutes of pure heaven) and the rain shower shower (you are completely covered by pulsing water) WOW! I didn't want to leave! The Room We finished up in the spa and got an early check-in so we headed up to our suite on the 10th floor. GORGEOUS! The decor, the view, the bedding, the towels (so soft) and the music playing when we entered the room...it was an incredible continuation of the Zen feel of the spa. Dinner at Bolla Dinner at Bolla was delicious! The food was great (Sous Vide Tenderloin, Stoneleigh Chocolate Cake) as was the service. We loved our meal and really took our time with the dining experienceâ€¦and never felt rushed! We even got a glimpse of celebrity chef, Caesar Gallegos. What a thrill! The Vibe The vibe of the hotel reaches a whole new level of fun at night...with the patio full of people having a drink and enjoying the ambiance. It was a great way to end the evening (we even headed across the street to the hopping Stoneleigh P for a night cap). The ZZZZZZZZZs Despite a wedding booked that weekend and other guests on our floor we heard NOTHING all night and slept like babies in our super comfortable king bed. Breakfast at Bolla We ended our stay back in Bolla for a late breakfast. The Illy coffee was amazing and piping hot...I never had an empty cup, the staff was so good at keeping it full (same with my water glass). The food was amazing (Chicken and Biscuits with Sage Gravy, Seasonal Fruit Plate). Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not ideal for business”
Reviews.Author: Ben_from_Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Stoneleigh was a great experience from start to finish, and I have only very minor complaints. The hotel is in a great location and my room was clean and spacious (though I was upgraded from a standard to a deluxe king room when I arrived). My only complaints: there's no coffee maker in the room (is this a new trend? why?), so if you're a business traveler, that means ordering it via room service or going without coffee before your morning meeting. It's annoying, but not fatal. Also, I ended up ordering breakfast in my room both days (it was pretty good) because I was afraid that the sit-down breakfast service would take too long. My only other complaint is that the equipment in the fitness center was pretty inadequate and outdated. It certainly wasn't up to the standards of the rest of the hotel. Overall, this hotel was a great value (I think I paid a $199/night rack rate) for its price class.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: dgely
Reviews.Content: At the last minute I changed my reservations to the Stoneleigh due to all the rave reviews on Tripadvisor. I was very pleased that I switched to the Stoneleigh. Great location, beautiful, newly renovated, very friendly and fantastic rooms. The only complaint was the air conditioning vent was right above the bed and it was a bit uncomfortable when it went on. I do not know if this applies to all the room. I loved the decor in the lobby. It reminded me Gaudi and the Casa Fuster in Barcelona. The bar was happening at night and the breakfast innovative and delicious. We also at a massage at the spa and it was very nice. I would absolutely recommend and and repeat my stay at the Stoneleigh.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tradewinns
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dallas for business on a frequent basis. This was my first stay at the Stoneleigh. Let me start by saying that I love the location, great places to eat within walking distance or a very short drive and easy access to the major highways. I was there for market and it took maybe 5 minutes to get to and from the Dallas Market Center to the hotel. The staff were all extremely courteous and friendly from the valet to the front desk to the gentleman who brought room service. Check in was quick and easy and the hotel lobby and bar area is lovely. My room was a great size. I used the sitting area each night to work, so nice to have instead of just a table and chair or desk. The walk in closet was nice and the decor was beautiful without being fussy. I loved the wall of 3 large windows overlooking Maple and the Stoneleigh P bar across the street. The bedding and pillows were top notch with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was small, but this is a historic hotel so that was to be expected. It was clean, well lit with a window so I could let in natural light for makeup application in the mornings. The toiletries provided were nice (and I'm picky). The one and only downside was a lack of good water pressure in the shower, but that was my only very small complaint. I had room service two nights and it was prompt and good. Yes, as some have mentioned there is some slight noise from a few planes and the Stoneleigh P but it was not bothersome and not noticeable after I closed the black out drapes for bed. This hotel is a gem, and I am certain that I will stay there again during a future trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Razorbackmomma
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Dallas, I love the personal feel. The valet service is quick, and friendly. The retro atmosphre is great. My only complaint is the airconditioning, it shuts off if your not in your room or very still during the night. Walk across the street and have a fantastic meal at Nick & Sams.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Barb0033
Reviews.Content: It is hard to chose a hotel online without knowing the area. I don't feel like this hotel was in a good location, but complimentary car service was advertised. When we called for a ride home, they were "too busy" to pick us up and told us to take a cab. Service was similar at the front desk and bar. There was a wedding party there the night that we stayed, so that may have been a factor. Lobby area was not so nice, but rooms were nice and clean. We also enjoyed outdoor bar area.

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: dawgday13
Reviews.Content: This is a hidden gem. Nicely appointed, large rooms with a huge shower (no tub). Great valet service. Active little bar with very good bartenders. Definitely our first choice in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “The Stoneleigh is fabulous and I look forward to staying again soon”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMarie
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Dallas recently on business and my colleagues and I were all thrilled with our accommodations at the Stoneleigh Resort & Spa. From the moment I arrived, excellent service was evidenced by the bell service in the drive offering to park my car and assist with luggage. The hotel room and bath were beautiful and comfortable. The food delicious, fresh and creative. The bar staff friendly and professional - and so sharp. Upon arrival, I enjoyed an excellent deep tissue massage followed by wonderful jacuzzi, which rejuvenated me for the remainder of my trip. The business center includes free computer use and printers. The fitness center has good, professional machines. The Stoneleigh is walking distance from Stanley Korshak (for shoppers) and the free trolley that takes you to an extensive variety of dining and night spots, as well as shopping. If I had to change something in this hotel, I would add a bit more space to the fitness center and more lighting in the room, but the entire experience was fabulous and I would have liked to stay another week.

Reviews.Title: “Stoneleigh Ruins Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: tuscanyguy
Reviews.Content: I had selected Stoneleigh to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We checked in and no one at check in informed us that we had a special package that should have included wine and breakfast. But more importantly, no one told us we would be put in a suite (handicapped room with no tub!) directly over a wedding celebration. The nerve racking noise started at 5:00PM and didn't end until after 11:00PM. The party was outside; below our 3rd floor window; and under our floor. The drunken celebrants swore and screamed into the night while the thumping music pounded our nerves. I called the front desk to complain and the manager asked what I wanted them to do! The next morning there were over $100 of charges for services we did not receive. It's been 2 days now since our horrific experience and no one from the hotel has called to apologize. The hotel ruined our anniversay and left my wife in tears. So this is a warning....DO NOT STAY AT THE STONELEIGH! They do not have a clue how to care for their guests. They are all about image but their management have no skills in serving and caring for their guests. Don't say I didn't warn you.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful alternative to the Hyatt Regency...you'll feel glamorous!"”
Reviews.Author: Genequeen
Reviews.Content: My friend and I ended up spending a couple of nights at the Stoneleigh because our conference hotel was full for the first two nights. We had both stumbled on the Stoneleigh separately, so we knew this was the one. What a treat! The Stoneleigh is a recently refurbished 1920s building, with a nice blend of art deco, modern, and traditional decor. The staff were great, and made us feel genuinely welcome, especially our concierge, Anthony. The room (a corner room) was incredible, with a dressing area, sitting area with a fashionable couch, large sleeping area with a nicely appointed king bed, and a *huge* bathroom. The sitting/sleeping area was bathed in light from the huge windows. The bathroom was like being in your own spa (although if you are sharing with a friend, the clear shower doors make sharing the bathroom tricky if one or both of you are modest!). I'm so used to staying in conference hotels that the turn-down service was a nice surprise! The high point of our stay was working with the concierge, Anthony...he was so accommodating and informative (and cheerful)! Love him! One of the drivers, Cliff, was also a hoot. Have him tell you about his experiences driving celebrities... We only ate at the hotel for breakfast, and it was a lovely experience...great food, classy service, and glam decor. I felt like a movie star. I didn't have the time or the budget on this business trip for the spa, but would love to try it out on a future stay. It was sad when my friend and I had to leave after our second night to stay in the conference hotel...the next time we will know better and book the whole stay at the Stoneleigh.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jojodoherty
Reviews.Content: I went for a weekend with my girlfriends. We were treated like queens. The rooms were spacious and extremely clean. The sheets were top of the line and beds extremely comfortable. We didn't need to get in the car, we could walk to lunch or take the free shuttle. The staff was excellent, they gave us a tour of the penthouse suite and a history lesson. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for nightlife”
Reviews.Author: Trish123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a football weekend and thoroughly enjoyed it. There is a lovely bar that serves delicious appetizers if you just want something light. The location is ideal for restaurants and nightlife - cabs are readily available if you prefer not to drive. The room was spacious - bathroom a little small but certainly manageable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...!”
Reviews.Author: lucy54753
Reviews.Content: This was our second time this year to stay at the Stoneleigh. It has so much character and charm, and is so elegant... all at the same time. It is not the typical style hotel to which we have all become accustomed... which is why we chose it the first time. The lighted chandeliers throughout are incredibly beautiful... the rooms are striking... decorated with a modern 50s look, yet the warm colors of dark wood and reds blend together to create a luxurious, yet fun and romantic, atmosphere. The bathrooms are wonderful... spacious, with black and white tiles, red accents. There is a window in the bathroom for natural lighting, which I loved. They have alot of nice touches throughout the room... the large walk-in closet is great. The staff was friendly and helpful... We ate at the Bolla restaurant once, and the food was fantastic. When back in Dallas, we would choose to stay there again, any day, any time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but nothing is nearby.”
Reviews.Author: wawdam
Reviews.Content: The Stoneleigh is a beautiful hotel. I'd recommend it if you have the $$ and a car. We didn't have a car and found nothing of note (cafes, stores, etc...) within walking distance, except for a pretty good bar, also called the Stoneleigh, across the street. Its a $10 - 15 cab ride to downtown, which worked for us. Staff was extremely attentive except when you needed something-- like a decent map or your suit to be pressed on time. Two hours after my suit was supposed to be pressed and returned, I called and asked them where it was, they said it would be done in 30 minutes. Obviously they haven't started. They had a whole day to do it. Rooms are spacious and really nice. Restaurant seemed to be gouging, with a pastry costing $4.

Reviews.Title: “Historical and Modern!”
Reviews.Author: mdaltonTX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary weekend and we really enjoyed ourselves. It's very close to Nick & Sam's which is a fabulous dinning experience. We walked there for dinner and then walked back for drinks in the Stoneleigh Bar. I was really impressed with all the decor and the spacious room. VERY LARGE closet, which was awesome! I was disappointed in the size of the bathroom. In our suite, the tub had a very hard time holding water, and the service tech came to fix it, but it really never worked right. We also had room service and it was very good for breakfast! Overall it was a fun weekend here in Dallas... I think it's a must experience hotel, just for the history!

Reviews.Title: “Good; not great”
Reviews.Author: SassieBelle
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the stoneleigh in dallas. The location is great, as is the service. Everyone is nice and attentive. The room prices are steep considering the lack of ammenities, but the rooms are very clean and spacious. The spa - nice people, but come on! The prices and the quality of the services are terribly lopsided! I'm convinced my esthetician was trying to crush my adam's apple during my facial, and i'm wondering if my deep tissue massage was performed my an 8 year old girl? Seriously underwhelming. The "relaxation room" was way to dark - don't put magazines in a room too dark to read! The changing area was teeny tiny and had seating for only 2 women at a time. My pedicure was sufficient but not memorable. I can't emphasize this enough - the people are SUPER nice. But...I'm fairly certain we will try some place else for our next visit to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Dallas...historic, modern, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Traveler71
Reviews.Content: The Stoneleigh is quickly becoming our favorite hotel in Dallas. We have stayed there twice this summer and have had superb experiences both times. The hotel is historic and very cool. It is a great, old building but has been restored lovingly with wonderful new furnishings. Its location is also superb...right in the middle of uptown with great access to major roads. The valet parking is an easy in and out and the staff is very helpful. The rooms are some of the best...the softess beds and pillows, very high quality linens, possibly the best hotel bathroom, and plush carpet. The color scheme of the hotel is very inviting. We also had a wonderful experience at Bolla on one of our visits. They were extremely accomodating to our kids during the visit. They even have a Stoneleigh coloring book!! which I have never seen a hotel do. The food was superb. For the dollar value, it is very hard to beat the Stoneleigh. The only way they can improve is to add a swimming pool. If this ever happens, I don't think we would stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever Spa... Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: rosieroad1228
Reviews.Content: What an absolute Surprise!! Booked a treatment at the Stoneleigh Hotel Spa just to kill some time and to relax after a long day. What a sleeper.... Beautiful dressing area, relaxation-waiting area, my therapist, Kass, was such a bonus!!! hydrotherapy pool, rainshower....exquisite products that were soooo yummy! Peace & Harmony... aesthetics and the sheer ability to do the job from the front desk forward. I have been to many, many spas around the country, this is in the top 3, by far.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dallasbill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary last night. We live in Dallas. We arrived early and had drinks at the bar. The bar is very comfortable and a small but able selection of beers. My wife had an excellent Pinot Noir by the glass. We ate dinner at Bolla, which was excellent. The room was huge, and very nicely appointed, and new. There was a nice view of downtown. The bath and shower were again very large and well designed. The staff was helpful and very professional. The rate was quite reasonable, especially for the quality of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, great location, large rooms that could be a little quieter.”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain4fun
Reviews.Content: The Stoneleigh was lovely and we had a beautiful room that was clean and ready upon arrival. The service was perfect from the valet, front desk, maids, bellmen, and bartender. What made this more special was that I had received a last minute deal on the room. Despite the greatly reduced rate, we were treated like royalty. Parking was expensive at $21, but it is what it is. The only downside was that the doors to the rooms have a large gap at the bottom and I could hear the elevator and the guests in the hall throughout the night. Fortunately, the maids were completely quiet as not to disturb the guests. Overall, It is a fun place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “So many extra fees for a "Luxury Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: parkerhbljones
Reviews.Content: I had a weekend trip to Dallas for a wedding. I was deciding between this and a similar hotel without a spa, but as we had an extra day with nothing planned, I thought having the spa was worth the extra $20/day difference in price. Upon arrival, we found out that valet was the only option, at an additional $21/day. I remarked that I wouldn't have minded had we known beforehand, but this felt a little like they were sneaking extra fees into the cost of the hotel. The next morning we were going to head down to the spa. Looking at the prices in the room, they were around 25% more than what was listed online. On top of that, a 20% gratuity was already added (apparently this is customary, but its conspicuously absent from the on-line price list). What I'd thought would be a $200 treatment turned into $300. The whole price-wrangling was very unfortunate, as both the hotel and staff were top-notch. The walls were a bit thin (my girlfriend spent one night listening to other guests conversations as they got on and off the elevator in the early morning) but they were very well-appointed and spacious. All the staff was very courteous and helpful. It's unfortunate that with the atmosphere they provide, you still feel like you've been offered one price and charged another.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gmurtha
Reviews.Content: I make about 40 trips a year for business and my most favorite hotel to stay in is The Stoneleigh. It is a renovated boutique hotel that, in my opinion, is second to none. The staff is incredibly attentive and personable, the bar offers great Happy Hour values and the room is fantastic. The Stoneleigh offers simple elegance at a reasonable rate and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I wish every hotel was like Stoneleigh”
Reviews.Author: justpeter
Reviews.Content: Stoneleigh is the perfect combination of comfort and professionalism. The rooms were comfortable, stylish and every convenience a business traveler or family needs. In Dallas, the only place I would want to stay is Stoneleigh.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: ketner
Reviews.Content: Of all the great hotels in Dallas, TX, we chose The Stoneleigh Hotel for our weekend getaway. The staff was extremely friendly, mannerly and accomodating. Our room was very well-appointed and the mattress, pillows and bedding were so comfortable and luxurious. Even more cozy than what we have at home! Room service was very speedy with delicious food. We truly enjoyed the spa treatments we selected from this first-class facility. We loved this boutique hotel and will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: PuffC
Reviews.Content: We were initially reluctant to book this hotel, because of the negative tripadvisor comments about the staff. However, it looked like such a nice hotel, and we got such a great deal on expedia, we just went for it. Big surprise - the staff were perfectly lovely. The valets, check-in staff, concierge, room service staff and housekeeping were all professional and courteous. Due to stressful car issues, we didn't end up having any spa treatments (they probably would've helped) or doing any sightseeing, so we just relaxed as much as possible in the hotel. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place, especially for couples. We booked a standard queen room, which was HUGE, with an even bigger bathroom stocked with fantastic products. My only complaint was with the room service food - I thought it was bland and unappetising.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing - Wanted to love the stay, but so many wrongs!”
Reviews.Author: AnotherBTraveler
Reviews.Content: I was so excited from the first moment I saw the hotel. Very cool place with great ambiance. Excellent location. Housekeeping was the worst I've had in a while. Left trash in (and around) rooms & wouldn't take dirty glassware we set out for removal. Robes and towels were left strewn about, and fixtures like makeup mirrors and soap dishes were falling off the walls. A call to fix was met with a jury-rigging that left it only partially hanging off the wall. Calls for extra towels were met with responses of "we're out of that those now." We had no cold water for one day, and part of the next evening. We were told that the hotel had a house car that could take us to an event, but when I tried to arrange for it with the front desk, I was told I should "just go down and ask and maybe they'll be able to take you. You'll just need to wait and see." On the bright side, the valet service was awesome and extremely helpful. I'd have to really think hard before I went back. I'd only recommend it with a "buyer beware."

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, HIstoric & Superb!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TXFinAdvisor
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is one of our favorites. The service is always great, the atmosphere puts you back to the good old days, and the elegance and quality of everything around you is unique and intoxicating. The rooms are awesome, and the location can't be beat., if you have never stayed here, justt go in and walk through the lobby, look around, you will be hooked.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique and Enjoyable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: timetraveler89
Reviews.Content: Stoneleigh Hotel is a fantastic place to spend a relaxing vacation. The beds are incredibly comfortable, the rooms well-appointed and the staff just about perfect. The spa is well worth a visit, especially Melanie who has the touch of an angel. The hotel management is excellent, and one of the managers, Mr. Cassells, was a pleasure to deal with and handles guest challenges with aplomb and a professionalism that is rarely experienced in the cut-throat world of hospitality. I hope to return to this hotel again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Neat Hotel and a Good Location- Elvis was here!”
Reviews.Author: Bittco
Reviews.Content: This is a neat hotel. From the outside it looks like an old 1930's style hotel and when you go in thats the feeling it keeps. The hallways are pink and the guest rooms are plush. My favorite thing about this place though was my room. I had a corner room and it had 4 giant windows. The view was amazing and the sunlight lit the room up beutifully. Apparently Elivs at one time stayed here reserving two whole floors for his entourage. The location is at the west of uptown and i guess at the start of oak lawn. Whichever neighborhood you put it in its a nice spot. It is close to turtle creek so there is a lot of trees yet it is a quick walk to the nightlife of McKinney and a 10-15 minute walk to downtown. Only valet parking is offered.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. Very luxurious!”
Reviews.Author: Scottyd783
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Very luxurious. Everthing is very expensive from restaurant, drinks in the bar etc however the quality of the fittings and furnishings were very plush. A very nice hotel ideal for impressing the special someone in your life. The room we stayed in was huge with a beautfiul bathroom. Only bad thing was situated in the financial district of Dallas and of a weekend everything is shut

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but plusses outweigh minuses”
Reviews.Author: Mblaca
Reviews.Content: First the plusses: This is a beautiful and stately hotel built in the early 1900s that exudes character. The desk and bell staff were friendly and helpful. It is in a great Dallas neighborhood - Uptown. Within walking distance are fine dining and casual restaurants, bank ATMs, convenience stores - all the things travelers look for. My room, 801, was a spacious corner room with a large comfortable bed. The bathroom had plenty of room, too. Free wireless internet was included. The minuses are mainly nit picks, but there were enough of them for me to give the Stoneleigh a qualified review. First, the desk in my room was useless. It was a narrow table pushed up against a wall and had no lamp and no electrical outlets nearby. To use my computer I had to rely on the glow from the bathroom lights and stretch a cord across the entrance to the bathroom. The desk chair was uncomfortable. The room needed a place where one could get some work done. One of the lamps next to the bed has no light bulb in it. That should have been remedied in advance of a guest checking in. The beautiful flat screen high definition TV didn't work. I called the front desk who said that engineering would be sent up. They never came. The next morning the TV worked, so perhaps they fied it remotely, but they never told me. I checked in at 7:30pm and was told that the dining room was closed for the evening. Huh? I was happy enough to walk down the street for dinner, but come on! I'll go back. I hope when I do management will have paid a little more attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel can be summed up in one word...WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: MelGreco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to Dallas to watch a Cowboy game and I decided to book at the Stoneleigh based on all the amazing reviews I have read. All I can say is it totally lived up to it's reputation. I don't have one bad thing to say about this hotel. I booked a studio suite and it was ENOROMOUS! The bathroom was the biggest hotel washroom I have ever seen. The bathtub was gigantic! Most importantly to me though was that the room was SPOTLESS! The restaurant is in a great location; our first night we walked to Nick & Sam's which is basically across the street. In the morning we a fabulous breakfast in Bolla followed by the best spa treatment "The Lavendar Aprodisiac Decedance for Two" it was excellent....a must for couples going to the Stoneleigh. After the spa we went to a Dallas Stars game...as it was a little chilly we were going to get a cab but the hotel offers compliemetary rides in the SUV Mercedes...which was fab! After the game we came back to the hotel and couldn't decide were to eat for the eveing. We asked the concierge Anthony for some suggestions; I don't think I have ever encountered someone so friendly and knowledgeable at any hotel I have stayed at; and my husband and I travel a lot within North America and Europe. Anthony was great he even went as far as to take us on a tour of the hotel and explaining the history and all the renovations that were done. For dinner we went to Chralie Palmers...if you go to Dallas...you must go there!!!! DELICIOUS! This hotel truely is a gem...if you are going to Dallas and you are looking for a high end, sophisticated hotel this is it. I'm only regretting not staying longer and that the weather wasn't hotter while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: DallasLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec. 10th - Dec. 13th and loved every minute of it. The rooms are decorated beautifully, the bar was hopping and a perfect atmosphere to kick back and relax, awesome food and great staff. We booked the room for $110 a night, too -- what a steal!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TexasShasta
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Stoneleigh in the past and enjoyed this historic hotel in the Uptown area of Dallas. However, recently we booked several rooms for extended family to gather for a celebration and found the experience disappointing. The rooms are great and the location was perfect for our visit - but this time the service made the stay less enjoyable than we expected. Maintenance issues were not addressed, the valets were difficult to locate and not always friendly, the front desk was not responsive to our complaints or knowledgeable about the area. The breakfasts at the restaurant were disappointing. The hotel seemed understaffed. There are lots of choices in Dallas and despite a great rate from hotels.com I'm sorry we chose the Stoneleigh.

Reviews.Title: “Classy.”
Reviews.Author: sonnierd
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the attention to detail from the staff. Room was really well appointed, and the bathroom was a highlight. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The mini-fridge and the pay-per-view movies had great selection.

Reviews.Title: “So impressed with the room and service, too bad no hote group affiliation”
Reviews.Author: SPGPlatHick
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Since it's renovation in 2008, I noticed that some of the older pictures by other TA'ers of the Stoneleigh have changed a bit. My assistant had found a great rate for the Stoneleigh and said that it had great reviews. She asked me to give it a try rather than the traditional Le Meriden Dallas North, W Hotel, Westin City Dallas, or Hyatt Reunion that I usually stay at. When I arrived at the hotel, I asked if there was self-parking available. There is no self-parking and Valet is a whopping $21.00/night! When I got to the Front Desk, I was warmly greeted by a gentleman named Angel. Though noisy from the happening bar, I was able to check-in ok. Angel offered me a Deluxe King Room. When I got to the room, I noticed that while, wonderfully appointed; it was a little small for my taste, but I am spoiled from all the upgrades from being an SPG Platinum. When I called Angel to see if there was anything else available, he asked me to come down and work something out. While he had upgrade for large extra fee per night, he was eager to keep me coming back here instead of the W or Le Meridien and upgraded me for free. He put me up in a Studio Suite, and what can I say? Fabulous! Here are some some pros and cons: + Beautifully appointed room + Environmentally friendly... They have paper laundry bags instead of plastic + Solid wood furniture + Classy look + Free Internet (Pretty fast during peak hours too!) + Service is very friendly and fast! (Angel is very eager to meet your needs) + Room is very clean, found no hairs left behind in bathroom + Brightly lit bathroom + Baroness Cali toiletries + Scale in bathroom (Rare thing now-a-days) + Turn down service, but no mint or chocolate. + Valet fast car retrieval - Valet only option at a whopping $21 a day! Le Meridien and The W don't charge that much. - No comforter available, extra blankets can be requested (It's almost winter!) - No complementary bottled water. Pay to drink - Need more available outlets by the work desk area - Can be noisy with traffic in the morning - No frequent stay loyalty program Overall, I was really impressed with this hotel, and I would definitely recommend this place for a personal or business stay. Find street parking if you can, because $21/day is ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, but a little disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: washburn321
Reviews.Content: This was a neat place with a lot of character to it. The location was great for us because we needed to be close to downtown, but also have access to the major highways to go North. We liked the room and the feel of everything, but were dissapointed with a couple of things. One, after we came back from dinner the lobby area smelled horrible (dirty diaper). Two, and probably the most important, the room never really cooled off. We stayed on a cool November night, but my wife and I woke up sweating. The A/C never cooled the room off and it was warm even with just the sheet on. For the price I expect the A/C to freeze the room out. Also, don't go to the bar across the street, horrible service. Valet was $20 a night. All in all we just had an average experience, but with a few fixes it could've been great.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated upscale boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Captexguy
Reviews.Content: This 1920's hotel has had a tasteful facelift including a stylish lobby with nice bar, restaurant and patio. Has a first class feel in its unique and attractive public areas. We were upgraded to a studio suite at check in and got the high floor we requested. The room was oversized with very high ceilings, lots of light and nice furnishings + a walk in closet. Sitting area and sleeping area are separated by a high console with the flat panel tv on top in a cabinet that pivots 180 degrees to be viewed from the sitting area or the bed. The bath is gorgeous and spacious with marble floors, granite counters,deep soaking tub and a window to let in natural light. All the finishes are first rate and upscale. The bed was comfy and the room was very quiet. Front desk was accomodating and any request we made of housekeeping or valet was accomodated. Everyone was professional but not stuffy. The available Mercedes SUV shuttle was handy and the hotel is in a good location on a quiet street just between downtown and Oak Lawn. Very near to American Airlines arena as well. My only complaint is that there is no pool. Otherwise, a great 2 night stay on a holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: plainsman66
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice property in a location that is very convenient to downtown. You can walt to some very nice restaurants from the hotel. The hotel has been renovated in the last year and it shows! The rooms are very nice but the bathroom deserves special mention. It was about 2-3 times the size of your normal hotel bathroom. The room had a waltz in closet (not to be confused with a walk in closet). I only wish that we had been staying more than one night. The parking is all valet which I considered a big plus. I had my vehicle loaded with a lot of items that I did not want to worry about and covered valet parking (accessible only to hotel personnel) solved that issue. Everyone I came into cotact with at the hotel was friendly and helpful. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, good location, staff a little stiff”
Reviews.Author: JBLR
Reviews.Content: Very cool and funky decor in an old but renovated hotel. The location is pretty good...near plenty of good eating places and close to some very good shopping too. The rooms are spacious and clean. Our only real complaint was the staff....the lobby bar staff was not friendly at all. The service was good but couldn't they at least smile a little and act like they weren't miserable with their job? The valet staff was better. The have a free shuttle (a Mercedes SUV) that will take you wherever you want to go within a few mile radius which will get you to some top notch food and shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “We will never go back.”
Reviews.Author: kklamb88
Reviews.Content: My mom and I went to The Stoneleigh as our end of our vacation spot. First off, there was nothing around for her and I today. I am too young to drink and so nightlife was out. Anyway, we spent most of our time in the room, and then had to leave so they could turn down our beds. No one told us that there wasn't a coffee maker, and very little was on the computer. My mom gets sick with down and the beds were down. We had a double queen, and the sheets on the bed didn't even reach down to the bottom of the bed! The water pressure was barely any, and the wake up call we ordered never came. Some staff were rude, others were very polite. In other words, after all the luxury hotels we had been to, this was the worst. It was a very pretty place, but not worth the money and not what we expected. The decorations were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility, RUDE staff!”
Reviews.Author: Fancy_Fashionista
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to the Hotel on a Friday afternoon, we were greated by a very polite gentleman/valet, who walked us in with our luggage. I wish I remembered his name...Glenn??? When my friend and I checked in, the front desk knew who we were and greeted us by name. It made me feel like I was in the Ritz. Allen was extremely courteous and even got us a room before check in time. As we went towards the room Anthony took our bags up and gave us the "tour".
