When he finished I explained that I'd get cash to tip him later, he said "no problem" then left. About 15 minutes later I was on my way to tip him for the bags. Unfortunately he did not see me coming and I over heard him speaking to another employee about my friend and I. He refferred to us as cheap MFR's. And a few other choice words directed to us and others who had not tipped him, words that can't be written. We were extremely offended! Obviously, I did not tip him. If the service I recieve is based on the amount of money that I give the staff at this hotel, then I will happily stay somewhere else. We returned late that night from a party and the lobby was very messy. We left the following morning to a lobby and bar filled with garbage, food, spilled drinks and beer bottles/cans along the walkway. NO ONE HAD CLEANED UP FROM THE NIGHT BEFORE?!!! Not to mention the sewer smell that came from the lobby floor. Hire a housekeeper! I would not recomend this place unless you're eager to throw around some tip money.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Service”
Reviews.Author: blueoveralls
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our experience at the Stoneleigh, and wished we could have stayed another couple of nights. From the moment we checked in until the time we checked out, the service was excellent - attentive, but not overbearing. The rooms were very clean, bathrooms of a good size for this type of hotel, very large closet, nice flat-screen TV, and the bed was very comfortable. We also stopped in the bar for dessert - it was delicious, and the service was fantastic. The bar/patio area was actually very busy the Saturday night we were there. We were in easy walking distance to the McKinney Trolley, which was very helpful since we had not rented a car. I'd love to stay here again and would recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Drew D
Reviews.Content: I use TripAdvisor and all the wonderful great reviews to choose this hotel in the first place, so I don't really think I'll add anything new that you have read elsewhere in these reviews. We arrived late in the afternoon and were greeted by a very courteous valet. Our bags were taken directly to lobby and as we checked in we were introduced to the concierge who handed us a welcome note (great touch) and he led us to our room on the eighth floor. As we traveled up the elevator and through the lobby the concierge, named Anthony, gave us the historic background about the hotel and showed us some of the features that they had restored. Our room was nicely appointed and we enjoyed a great night stay at the hotel. We did not have a chance to try the spa but we did explore the top floor which is pretty spectacular. I'm a big fan of historic venues in the Stoneleigh certainly fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Leesa2009
Reviews.Content: WOW! This hotel is really gorgeous, the rooms are immaculate, the service excellent and the history - so interesting! We only stayed one night but it was wonderful! Also the Bolla restaurant made the most delicious brekkie. Try the signature blueberry pancakes YUM!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is noisy!”
Reviews.Author: vtlinck
Reviews.Content: A nice renovation spoiled by the failure to double glaze the windows. Every car, truck, and motorcycle that passes the hotel is clearly audible in the guest rooms. In addition, the hotel is on one of the approaches to Love Field, so plane noise is a problem until that facility closes around 11 PM. But, worst of all is the presence of a late night club accross the street that features a patio open until 2 AM. Loud music and revelling are very audible in the rooms facing Maple St. This hotel is far too expensive for these problems. I recommend the Hotel Za Za nearby which is similarly priced and has similar amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackandSally
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in Fort Worth and go to Dallas every wedding anniversary for a quick getaway. We normally stay at Hotel Zaza but after reading about the recent renovations to the Stoneleigh and comparing rates we decided to give this 1923 hotel a try. We were immediately impressed upon entering the hotel. The decor was very nice, modern but it didn't detract from the historic feel of the building. We arrived early on a Saturday morning around 945 am and didn't expect our room to be ready. After eating brunch we returned and were told that although our assigned room (a mini-suite) wasn't ready we were going to be upgraded to a "Signature Suite." We were given room 300. Unfortunately our room key card didn't work. A manager let us in the room and told us that maintenance would come fix the lock immediately and would bring us new key cards. The room was very nice. It was a large corner room with lots of windows. Upon entering the large bathroom I realized we were in a wheelchair accessible room. There was no bathtub, just a showering area in the corner that was surrounded by a shower curtain. I don't think the room was much different from what I had originally reserved other than being slightly larger (to allow wheelchair access) and being a corner room. The decor was very nice, classy and modern but not so modern as to take away from any of the history of the hotel. The rich woods of the bed and dresser matched well with the turqouise in the carpet and curtains. The was a minibar, a flat screen TV, and a safe. We waited for someone to fix our door for a while but after an hour and a half gave up and went out for drinks. We were within walking distance of Crescent Court, Hotel Zaza, and the Ritz. When we returned several hours later the key issue had been fixed. The bed was very comfortable, we slept well. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant, Bolla, was fantastic. The room was definately worth the $239 rate we paid. Valet, unfortunately, was $21 a night, but that is more or less the going rate for the hotels in the area. The Stoneleigh isn't as sexy and fun as a Hotel Zaza, but it is beautiful, romantic, and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel that really reflects the uptown arts district...”
Reviews.Author: jorydotcom
Reviews.Content: We checked in on April 18 for a one night stay. The concierge, Anthony, was very nice and helpful - he took us on a short tour of the hotel, pointing out the historical aspects we would find interesting. Later, he helped us get directions to a wedding and reception site - and offered to have the hotel driver take us. I used the spa services the next morning and it was really relaxing. If you're staying in the area, try Hully & Mo's for lunch or dinner. Anthony recommended it to us - great food and a very classy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous, fabulous - recommended”
Reviews.Author: LondonAmg
Reviews.Content: got a deal on Stoneleigh with Expedia and so glad we did. The staff were lovely, and the hotel has recently been revamped to a fantastic standard. The room was huge with a bathroom I wanted to take home. Very comfortable, very clean. We ate at the restaurant one night, which was excellent. The bar was nice too. It's in a great location, handy for the free trolley, and walkable to West Village's shops, restaurants and bars. Definitely would recommend staying here rather than downtown Dallas - there is nothing and nobody there!

Reviews.Title: “They covered every possible detail!”
Reviews.Author: famus_darling
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went stayed at The Stoneleigh and had a fabulous time. This hotel was close to everything in downtown/uptown Dallas. It was close to the trolly, walking distance to shopping and some great resturants. The staff at the Stoneleigh was great, starting with a little tour when we first checked in. We went on a rainy weekend, so we put the umbrella in the closet to use. We loved the little chocolates with turn down service every night. I got a chance to utilize the spa and it was fabulous. The manager was kind enough to work with my tough schedule and even opened early for me. My spa services were some the best I have EVER received. I suggest the maple park brown sugar scrub and wrap. We got a great last minute deal on hotels.com, so don't forget to check for deals. The few things that bothered me, there was no self serve parking, the stool was extremely close to the vanity, thought there was more, but that's all i can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: SDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Premier Rooms at the Stoneleigh. It was a lovely, good size, corner room with a nice big bathroom. Our only gripe was the described "sitting area" was a chair in the corner. We just moved it to the open space we thought it should have been in, and we were happier. The renovations of the hotel are beautiful. The chandeliers in the lobby and bar held my attention for a long time. The hotel is described as Beaux-Arts and Art Deco. Truly beautiful. Lots of history. And a good location. We walked to Nick and Sam's for dinner, and had other options within walking distance, too.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Girlygirl001
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I loved our stay at the Stoneleigh! We arrived to a warm reception at valet, From there Scott helped us with our luggage, he was very nice and he helped us to settle in our room. The room was a studio suite, which was the perfect size, the closet was quite large as well. Lance, the concierge, made us reservations at a GREAT restaurant! He also gave us some great ideas of what to do while we were in town, which made it so much easier for us. He even drove us to our destinations. Thanks again Lance! Everything else went perfectly! We would recommend this Hotel above any other we've stayed at in Dallas. We will see you guys again soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichardofAnnapolis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Stoneleigh Hotel and Spa for two nights at the end of January and the experience was wonderful! The Stoneleigh his a beautiful hotel situated in uptown Dallas about a mile and a half from the center of the city. It is in a quiet, yet busy area that is both residential and commerical. The decor of the hotel is art deco and is reflected throughout the entire property. The lobby is filled with dark marble and the furniture and decorations look straight out of the 1920s/1930s. We arrived at the hotel very late due to an ice storm, but check-in was quick and efficient. The room itself, a studio suite was gorgeous. The bed was comfortable, as was the couch and chair. The room was rectangular and was devided in the middle by a oblong dresser which had the TV, a 40" LG that was very nice. It seemed that the hotel had HD on most channels. The coolest aspect was that the TV swivled 180 degrees, so that you could turn it to the bed when in bed and turn it to the couch when you were in the living room portion of the suite. The bathroom was art deco as well with the tiles a black and white checkerboard pattern. The bathroom amenities were plentiful and there were more lotions/shampoos/conditioners/body washes etc than you could shake the proverbial stick at. We forgot tooth paste on our trip and after a quick call to guest services they delivered some to our room in about a minute flat! Outstanding service. The service at the hotel was excellent. There is a complimentary guest shuttle that will take you anywhere you need to go in a five mile radius of the hotel. Cliff seemed to be the principle driver and he was very convivial and told us a lot about Dallas and the environs. Lance, one of the concierge was also great and personally drove us to Union Station the day of our departure. While we did not have a chance to sample the spa on our trip it looked very appealing. They also have a business center which was very convenient. We also had two meals in the restaurant. The first was dinner which is delivered in courses. The food was very good, though on the expensive side. Unfortunately, that is often the case will hotel restaurants. We also had breakfast the next day, which was excellent. The servers are very attentive and your water glass and coffee never run dry. They also have complimentary coffee in the lobby until 11:00am, which was very good. All things considered it was an excellent experience. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is traveling to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jamardrob
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Stoneleigh on a quick business trip and it was a great hotel...they did a great job with the renovation. The room was large, nicely decorated and appointed with a large walk-in closet, flat screen TV, and nicely stocked mini-fridge/bar (extra cost of course). The bathroom was also very nice with granite tops and a large tub that would be great for soaking if that's your thing. When I arrived (really late) and walked into my room, the bed was turned down with a robe laid on the bed, flat screen TV turned on and the bathroom light on ready for my use. This was also done for me on the next night when I returned from dinner. The Staff was also very accomodating and helpful. One of the Concierges, Anthony, was great, giving me recommendations on good restaurants in the area. Also, since I had not rented a car and was taking cabs, he personally offered to drive me to the restaurant and pick me up in the house car, a late model Mercedes. I wanted to check out the spa but I could not get a same-day appointment in the evening (as I was working during the day), so I would recommend booking services early. However, the fitness center was nice and appropriate for a hotel of the Stoneleigh's size. To wrap up, it was a great stay, I would definitely recommend it to friends, family, and colleagues!

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSemone
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a business trip to Dallas and a two day stay at the historic The Stoneleigh Hotel & Spa. The hotel was a beautiful mix of art deco meets modernism. The room was nice although the air conditioning was quite finicky. The beds were also pretty hard. Everything in this hotel has been redone wonderfully so you would think they would go the extra mile on the beds as well. I think they are still trying to work out some kinks from their new remodel because I felt that they were a little out of sink on the service end. The staff could not be nicer, but I ordered a wake up call and it never came in. They were also not very flexible with room service-- I tried to order breakfast a bit after the time and they would not do it. Most hotels will give you anything they can easily make at any time of the day. They also have a house car service that takes guests within a 3-5 mile radius of the hotel. The driver would not take me 2.5 miles down the road because of Traffic...Go figure -- traffic in Dallas. I think aesthetically speaking The Stoneleigh is a wonderful property. I would say that I would be back, but the beds will hinder me from doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Classy Digs”
Reviews.Author: vajamesfamily
Reviews.Content: We took a short 4 day/ 3 night trip for pleasure and gave this renovated hotel a shot. We were not disappointed. The true test of a hotel is how it deals with issues that arise. I had two small ones: a gurgling sink (fixed without a hitch while I went to the bar), and a room change request (done without having to whine about it). We needed to change rooms due to our room being right next to the service elevator. I'm a light sleeper and found this particular room quite noisy. I could hear the ping, ping of the bell all night as well as guests getting ice from the machine across the hall. The next morning, I requested a different room and they complied, no problems. The room on the 9th floor was quieter, great view, spotlessly clean, gorgeously decorated in the latest style trends. Super cool HDTV. That was the extent of any "issues". The rest: All perfection. It's a beautiful hotel, you will feel pampered. Drinks are strong, staff never fails to ask if they can get you something. Even the hotel guests are friendly. The bed was exquisite; wish I was there now. Skip the car and walk two blocks to Nobu at the Crescent. OMG. The sushi is great and the atmosphere dark and sexy. Want something more casual? Watch a Cowboys Game at the McKinney Ave. Tavern, wear your jersey and enjoy the big screen TVs. Get your Starbucks fix around the corner, sit outside on the patio and people watch. This is one hotel I will definitely return to, next month in fact. There are lots of hotel choices in Dallas, but you can't go wrong with The Stoneleigh.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spa!!!”
Reviews.Author: suzyq425
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! I booked the premier king room for $132/night on expedia but read reviews on tripadvisor.com. Noticed that I should join Preferred hotels to get an upgrade if it was available and I did. We got a double upgrade to a studio that is normally $400/night because it was available! Awesome room for the price we paid! The price of the food at the hotel is high, but there aren't any good restaurants real close by. We stayed at the hotel most of the time. Bring a coffeemaker, so you don't have to spend $14 for a pot of coffee! I make hot coffee and tea and iced tea. Cokes at this place were $4! So we just drank coffee and tea that I made. Spent 2 days at the spa. Awesome! This is THE hotel to choose, hands down! We had tix to see Tina Turner, and the American Airline Center was only 1 mile away. We went to the JFK Museum which was good--about a 2 hour trip to venture through but had to wait about 1 hour to get in there in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Mustangfootballmom
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dallas often to see my son who attends SMU and usually stay elsewhere but my regular hotel was booked and they actually told me about The Stoneleigh. It was a pleasant surprise. Great hotel, great service, very clean and upscale decor. Rooms were very comfortable, loved the spa too. I would highly recommend this one to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “The Top TA Rated Hotel in Dallas??”
Reviews.Author: GregontheLake
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based upon prior TA user reviews which ranked this hotel as the top hotel in Dallas. I am rarely disappointed by recommendations from TA users, but am in this case. Just returned from a weekend stay with my wife and on one hand the decor and ambience of the hotel is very good. However, there were a number of service gaffes that I would not expect from a top ranked hotel. On the positive side, the lobby and bar area are well done. We had a smaller room with a king bed and the decor was very attractive and new. So physically, the interior of the hotel is beautiful. However, I had higher expectations of service where the hotel really dropped the ball. Arrived Friday afternoon and room was not ready. OK, and they did call later in the afternoon to let me know when my room was ready. Asked to have our bags which were left with the bellman delivered to the room. Returned to the hotel later to get the room key and found my bags were not in the room. Called the front desk to tell them and was told the bellman would deliver them. They did not arrive. Called again and was told the bellman was unavailable and they would have someone else deliver our bags. Got another call to the room as they then could not find our bags. By this time we were going to be late for our event that evening. Finally the front desk employee brought the bags himself to the room. Went back down to get our car from the valet and we were running late. All parking is done by the valet for a $20 daily fee. There were three valet parkers and one went to get our car and then came back and asked what our name was as he could not locate our car. Another 15 minutes and we are even later for our evening plans. We did not try the spa this trip, but I got such a poor first impression on service and stayed in other midtown hotel properties where I did not experience these service problems that I more than likely will not stay at this hotel again. There is condo construction right next door associated with the Stoneleigh and although we were on the 7th floor, there was sufficient noise even during the evening from surrounding establishments heard from our room. Last comment, while the room was nice. I did not enjoy the placement of the AC vents which oddly enough were across the room from the king size bed but blew directly in our faces while in bed and the vents were not adjustable. Not a huge disappointment, but not deserving of the top ranking of Dallas hotels in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: KaptainKool
Reviews.Content: Very nice and comfortable. i would give it excellent but the parking was under construction. the valet was nice but not much room to drive.that was the only inconvenience. great rate for specials. large plasma tv and the rooms were big and comfortable. breakfast was pricy but good. nice lounge. friendly and helpful staff. we did not have time to use the spa though. location was good, north of downtown. if you can make it through the dallas construction then it is well worth the stay. a great romantic weekend getaway for a couple. i did not see any children. did not walk anywhere. north of the hotel is kinda seedy but south looks nice. will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great pedicure!”
Reviews.Author: alice1964
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and loved it! The decor was great. Very roomy bathroom. The service was good. The best part was my pedicure. The spa downstairs is just wonderful. Very soothing. The food was delicous, although some of the portions were a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “The Stoneleigh is Back!”
Reviews.Author: dougiefreshpdx
Reviews.Content: Before it closed for a full remodel, the once-proud Stoneleigh had sunk about as low as you can get. We're talking big rodents, bad rooms and scary people in the lobby, folks. So it was a bit angst-inducing for me to book a night at the new version of this hotel. But I'm glad I did. The rooms are excellent; basically double the size of the past version and nicely furnished. Excellent facvilities, nice bar and very good restaurant as well. I'd like to give special mention to the consigere, Kat, who let me use the shower downsdtairs after I had gone running even though I had checked out earlier in the day. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Spot in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: UTAustin
Reviews.Content: The recent renovations at the Stoneleigh put it on par with just about any other top hotel in Dallas. In addition the staff does a very nice job of welcoming guests. I had one of the studio suite rooms. It's one large room divided by a large wooden double sided dresser with a flat panel TV on top. The bed is located on one side and a sofa and chair are on the other. You can adjust the TV to view it on either side. The bathroom is one of the nicest I've seen in Dallas. The marble floor and tile walls had a very clean look. The soaps and shampoos were top-tier. In addition, there were plenty of towels and they were very soft and clean smelling. The bed was very comfortable. It was turned down in the evening when I returned to my room, along with a robe and chocolates left out for me. There was also an ample closet, with an ironing board, starch, etc. The air conditioner in my room was a bit finicky at first, but seemed fine after a while. The hotel also offers your choice of papers in the morning - the WSJ, NYT or DMN. (I suspect they'd find a Star-Telegram for you too, if you asked). The hotel is easy to get to from Love Field, though your only real choice is valet parking. The hotel has a small but active bar in the lobby. In addition, it's fairly close to most of the downtown restaurants, etc. If you're looking to mix things up a bit in your trips to Dallas, this is a great new place to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, not as convenient as staying downtown”
Reviews.Author: kkbenton
Reviews.Content: I'm spending 4 weeks working in downtown Dallas and staying at 4 different hotels. The Stoneleigh is definitely the nicest - the rooms are a step up from the Adolphus, but it was somewhat inconvenient for getting downtown. Its a quick drive, but considering the overnight parking at the Stoneleigh is $21.65 and then daily parking downtown is $15-20, it makes more sense to leave the car at the hotel. That means either cabbing it, taking the bus, or the trolley. The walk involved with the trolley was too far in business clothes and the trolley is not air conditioned (not good in the summer.) You can catch the bus right outside the Stoneleigh and it dropped me off a block from the building, but its a jolting, bumpy ride and you have to have exact change, in cash. IMO, there's a big difference between this hotel and the Adolphus - everything about the Stoneleigh was updated, pristinely clean, and top notch. They did turn down service with chocolates, had these great robes, and flat screen TVs. They actually provided starch with the iron. I really enjoyed the comfortable seating on the front deck. Its also a quick walk down to the Katy Trail and the park on Turtle Creek. Most of the restaurants within walking distance are pretty expensive. We had pizza and salad at Coal Vines for $25/each. It was good, but ouch! Mattitos was good and more reasonable. One issue I had was the design of my room put the bed right next to the door and the room was very close to the elevators, which made for a noise problem. I was also woken up at 4am by a hotel employee using a 2 way radio right outside my door. Check Expedia for prices - it was $130/night for the week I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Renovated”
Reviews.Author: saintba
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 3 night stay at the Stoneleigh Hotel & Spa in Dallas. I booked the hotel from their website and booked a Studio Suite. I had to come into town for a meeting and also to do some shopping before heading to New York. I was flying from Buenos Aires and the flight got in very early at 7 AM. I emailed ahead of time and asked if I could check-in early and one of the managers, Anita, confirmed it would be fine. The hotel is in a great area conveniently located in the Uptown Area. Itâ€™s very close to downtown and also you have quick access to the Tollway and also Highway 75. Itâ€™s also close to Highland Park where my friend lives so it was convenient. The hotel has recently been renovated and the hotel got a nice write up in the Wall Street Journal last week. They just finished a $36 million renovation. The lobby isnâ€™t anything over the top but nice. I never stayed at the hotel before the renovation so I canâ€™t compare it to before but itâ€™s nice. My room was very big with 4 large windows, a king size bed, a big 46â€™ high definition TV, nice bathroom and a walk in closet with plenty of room. The bed was very comfortable as well. My air conditioning wasnâ€™t working right the first day and I complained and they sent up a maintenance worker right away and he confirmed it was just blowing air and fixed it. The staff was always very friendly. My only complaint/problem was the first day I called down to ask for some razors to shave (I forgot to pack them). The front desk confirmed they would send someone up with some. They never did even after 3 calls down to the desk. They kept saying, â€œsomeone is on their way upâ€� but they never came. I would have just preferred them saying they didnâ€™t have any if they didnâ€™t. Also, the biggest problem is the valet parking area. Itâ€™s extremely small and not well organized. Most people coming in town will probably have a rental car as taxis arenâ€™t too common in Dallas compared to other large cities. They charge u$s 21 per day for parking which is common in hotels in this area. The problem is that people come to the hotel for dinner to eat or to have drinks in the bar so that parking area is a total zoo. The guys seem to try but they had some problems. I called down to have my car ready and sometimes they didnâ€™t have it ready and one night I had to wait almost 20 minutes for my car. 1 time they couldnâ€™t find my keys. Also, the night that it was really hectic was a Friday and I went out and drove to nearby Highland Park to pick up a friend for dinner and I noticed the valet guys left someone elseâ€™s car keys in my front seat! Fortunately I was going to dinner at Craft which was close by so I stopped by the hotel to drop off the keys. I canâ€™t imagine if I didnâ€™t notice them and bring them back what the hotel would have done for this guest/customer if they wanted to leave. I found this a bit troubling. Really the only complaint I had was the valet parking situation but the hotel was great. One thing to note is they are building a building next door to the hotel so there is a bit of noise in the morning and throughout the day. If you want to sleep in and are a light sleeper, keep this in mind. All in all a great hotel with friendly staff and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay for Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: ztraveler-6
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night for our anniversary! We had read that the hotel had been renovated so we thought it was worth trying out especially after the great reviews the new restaurant had received. We had the most wonderful evening. The hotel has been beautifully restored from the lobby to the rooms. The only thing I wish they had were bigger elevators. Our room however was big with a sitting area that you can actually use and the bed was very comfortable. After settling in we went to the lobby bar and had a drink, then went outside and enjoyed people watching. The best of the night was the Bolla restaurant. We had a six course meal. The chef, Chef Bull, was on Iron Chef as well which as cool. He walked around and greeted everyone. This hotel is great and the location is perfect to give a neat city feel since its near downtown but also in a neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Stunning Hotel - Great Rates!”
Reviews.Author: torav
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas to see the Stars play, and wanted something within a reasonable distance from American Airlines Center. The W and the Ritz (along with a number of other Boutique hotels) were close by and charging $350-450 for the night. The Stoneleigh was at $210 - so we opted it for it because it was newly renovated. What a beautiful hotel. They aren't exaggerating when they say a 40 million makeover. We had to wait for our room, and decided to have a cocktail. When paying our tab, the manager came over to tell us that the hotel was picking it up due to the wait. NICE! The rooms are HUGE. The room has a king bed on one side, a sofa area on the other - it's divided by a credenza with a flat screen tv that turns between the room. There is a huge walk in closet and a nice big bathroom. When leaving for the hockey game we went to get a cab - instead the house car (nice NEW Mercedes) pulled up and offered us a complimentary ride to the center. No charge - but we did tip $10 for the ride. The only negative is the amount of construction in that area - I'm never bothered by noise - I always have my earplugs with me. Just a heads up to anyone who books anywhere in downtown Dallas. Oh - and the rooms don't have coffee makers - just pop down to the bar where they have a complimentary coffee bar set up. Lastly, I checked prices on all the internet companies, and then booked directly with the hotel - who matched their price (their on-line rate was a bit higher). They were very accomodating!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: stephparisoli
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week. Nice hotel. Health Club is pretty small. Restaurant is beautiful. The dinner menu is really rich but had a great selection. Breakfast was delicous. My server must have been in theater because he was very dramatic for 7am in the morning. Negative-My bathroom had lots of little black hairs which grossed me out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!! Fabulous Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnastaciaDallas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. A remarkable difference from before renovations. Staff was friendly and accomodating. Room was large and very comfy. Hotel is elegant without being stuffy. I would stay again and recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “wow!”
Reviews.Author: lisa945
Reviews.Content: The new Stoneleigh Hotel & Spa is utterly stunning! (I had stayed at the hotel prior for a family reunion in 2004 and was met with a historic hotel in desperate need of renovation). The new Stoneleigh is a different story--- my girlfriends and I enjoyed awesome spa treatments (Luxe Parafin Mani/Pedi) and cocktails on their huge patio overlooking Uptown Dallas. The rooms are gorgeous and HUGE!
